docs.lead_paragraph: Russian news reports say curious and pious people are visiting a bust of the last czar in the Crimean capital after reports spread that the sculpture appeared to be weeping.

headline.print_headline: Czar Bust in Crimea Reportedly Appears to Shed Tears
headline.main: Czar Bust in Crimea Reportedly Appears to Shed Tears

docs.snippet: Russian news reports say curious and pious people are visiting a bust of the last czar in the Crimean capital after reports spread that the sculpture appeared to be weeping....

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican leaders in Maine and Utah are asking President Donald Trump to step into uncharted territory and rescind national monument designations made by his predecessor.

headline.main: Republicans in Maine, Utah Want Trump to Undo Monuments

docs.snippet: Republican leaders in Maine and Utah are asking President Donald Trump to step into uncharted territory and rescind national monument designations made by his predecessor....

docs.lead_paragraph: Deniz Yucel, a German-Turkish journalist arrested last week in Turkey, views his solitary confinement in Turkey as "almost a form of torture," but said his health and mental condition are good, the German newspaper he reports for said on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Journalist Says in Solitary Confinement in Turkey: Newspaper
headline.main: Journalist Says in Solitary Confinement in Turkey: Newspaper

docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Theresa May will write to European Council President Donald Tusk this month [L5N1GG31G] to trigger Britain's withdrawal from the European Union under Article 50 of the EU treaty.

docs.lead_paragraph: Five months of multi-sided clashes in Syria's crowded northern battlefield have displaced some 66,000 people, a U.N. humanitarian agency said Sunday, a day after the U.S. bolstered Kurdish-led forces with a deployment of armored vehicles amid preparations for a push toward the Islamic State group's de facto capital.

headline.print_headline: UN Says 66,000 Displaced in 5 Months of North Syria Fighting
headline.main: UN Says 66,000 Displaced in 5 Months of North Syria Fighting

docs.lead_paragraph: A British daredevil known for his vertigo-inspiring online videos chronicling his climbs up buildings and construction cranes was interrogated by Dubai police over his recent ascents in the sheikhdom, authorities said Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Dubai Police Question British Daredevil in Skyscraper Climbs
headline.main: Dubai Police Question British Daredevil in Skyscraper Climbs

docs.lead_paragraph: Visiting New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Sunday that a recent rash of anti-Semitic acts in the United States was "reprehensible" and his state would have no tolerance for them.

headline.print_headline: Cuomo Calls Anti-Semitic Attack in New York 'Reprehensible'
headline.main: Cuomo Calls Anti-Semitic Attack in New York 'Reprehensible'

docs.lead_paragraph: Cursive writing is looping back into style in schools across the country after a generation of students who know only keyboarding, texting and printing out their words longhand.

headline.print_headline: Flip the Script: Cursive Sees Revival in School Instruction
headline.main: Flip the Script: Cursive Sees Revival in School Instruction

docs.snippet: Cursive writing is looping back into style in schools across the country after a generation of students who know only keyboarding, texting and printing out their words longhand....

docs.lead_paragraph: Two big Irish energy projects designed to reduce dependence on Britain are set to benefit from EU funding as the bloc steps up efforts to support the country with the most to lose when its bigger neighbor quits the European Union.

headline.print_headline: EU Readies Cash to Help Ireland Cut Energy Dependence on Brexit Britain
headline.main: EU Readies Cash to Help Ireland Cut Energy Dependence on Brexit Britain

docs.lead_paragraph: Defectors who arrive from the North with important information on the military or the regime’s inner workings will get $860,000, up from $217,000.

headline.print_headline: Hoping to Lure High-Level Defectors, South Korea Increases Rewards
